title.en: There is - Singular & Uncountable (Hay singular e incontables)
title.es: There is - Singular & Uncountable (Hay singular e incontables)

description.en: Learn to use 'there is' for singular countable nouns and uncountable nouns. Spanish speakers often confuse singular/plural forms of 'hay', but English requires 'there is' (there's) for singular and uncountable nouns.
description.es: Aprende a usar 'there is' para sustantivos contables en singular y sustantivos incontables. Los hispanohablantes a menudo confunden las formas singular/plural de 'hay', pero el inglés requiere 'there is' (there's) para sustantivos singulares e incontables.

prompt.es: Hay una gran nube negra en el horizonte.

exercises.solution: There's a big black cloud on the horizon.

tip.en: Use 'there's' (there is) for singular countable nouns.
tip.es: Usa 'there's' (there is) para sustantivos contables en singular.

prompt.es: Hay un agujero en la suela de mi zapato.

exercises.solution: There's a hole in the sole of my shoe.

tip.en: Use 'there's' (there is) for singular countable nouns.
tip.es: Usa 'there's' (there is) para sustantivos contables en singular.

prompt.es: Hay un arroyo al final de mi jardín.

exercises.solution: There's a stream at the end of my garden.

tip.en: Use 'there's' (there is) for singular countable nouns.
tip.es: Usa 'there's' (there is) para sustantivos contables en singular.
